segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the Payment valuation document name, number and function.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates that apply, e.g. date of valuation, date of submission, acceptance date, etc.

segment.name: Authentication result
segment.documentation: AUT, A segment used to authenticate the message by exchanging a password or some other form of identification agreed between the trading partners.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used for any textual qualification. In computer to computer exchanges, such text will require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments for quoting references and their relevant dates that are applicable to the message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for quoting references that are applicable to this whole message. e.g. contract identity, operational references, former valuation reference number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Dates of references quoted in the previous RFF segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the valuation. Identification of the contractor and client parties is mandatory for the valuation message. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the NAD segment e.g. internal site/building number.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution (e.g. bank) and relevant account numbers for the contractor, client and where necessary other parties.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments for giving references only relevant to the specified party rather than the whole valuation.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying the documentary requirements of the specified party.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying and providing information relating to the documents required by the party specified by the NAD.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time of the document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments specifying the currencies and related dates/periods valid for the whole valuation. Currency data may be omitted in national applications but will be required for international transactions.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currencies required in the valuation e.g. the valuation currency. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to convey the new fluctuation indices values.

segment.name: Index details
segment.documentation: IND, A segment to provide a new value of the quoted index.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to indicate the reference of the index.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to convey the new date of value of the quoted index.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to indicate: - the financial total amounts of the valuation or parts of it - conditions of payments - conditions of allowances and charges, bonuses and penalties - the total amounts to be paid directly to subcontractors (request or confirmation).

segment.name: Structure identification
segment.documentation: BII, A segment to identify the group of items to which the valuation amounts stated in the group of segments apply. The identification of the groups of items referred to here has already been conveyed through another appropriate EDI message.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to provide requirements that are applicable to the whole group of items referred to in BII.

segment.name: Payment instructions
segment.documentation: PAI, A segment indicating conditions of payment, guarantee and method of payment for the whole group of items referred to in BII.

segment.name: Payment terms
segment.documentation: PYT, A segment indicating the payment terms, date/time basis, and additional terms valid for the whole group of items referred to in BII.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment used to provide percentages at contract or sub- contract level.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to convey the results of the computation of the fluctuation formulas and the relevant dates/periods. This group is used to provide only price variation resulting from the computation of the fluctuation price formula, excluding any amount.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment to indicate the price fluctuation computation.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate the date or period of application of the factor quoted in APR.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to convey the financial amounts related to the group of items referred to in BII and their relevant taxes and if necessary the details of their computation.

segment.name: Monetary amount function
segment.documentation: ARD, A segment to convey a financial status of the following information.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to convey monetary amounts related to the group of items referred to in BII and to the financial nature quoted in ARD.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used for any textual qualification. In computer to computer exchanges, such text will require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments specifying tax related information, and when necessary, the location(s) to which that tax information relates.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying a tax type, category and rate, or exemption, relating to the group of items referred to in BII. e.g. Value Added Tax at the standard rate is applicable for all items.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the identified tax/fee.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location to which the tax or exemption specified in the TAX segment applies, e.g. city or state or country tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments used to provide amounts breakdown related to price variation rate. It provides all information needed to compute these amounts.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment used to provide the price variation rate which is used as a basis for calculation of the following amounts.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment used to provide references used as a basis for calculation of the following amounts.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to provide dates used for the calculation of the price variation rate.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment used to provide the amount to be paid and all amounts used in the calculation of this amount.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment used to provide tax related information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: SG17-SG18 A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the group of items referred to in BII. The allowance or charge specified within this Segment group may either relate to the group of items referred to in BII in which case it cannot be overridden at item level, or it can relate to the line items as a default allowance/charge and can be overridden by the ALC Segment group within the item section. Where relevant, additional information, tax and alternate currency details are to be indicated in the TAX and MOA segments. The basis for the calculation of the allowance/charge may be a quantity, a percentage, an amount or a rate and one of the Segment group 14-17 should be used accordingly.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary its calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, To reference rules applied when setting the bonus or penalty. This may apply to price variation calculation formula itself described in price fluctuations above.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, To provide dates used in setting bonus and penalty.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, To provide free text information used in setting bonus and penalty. It may be used to provide the nature of the bonus or penalty or to provide complex calculation rules.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments specifying the quantity of the allowance or charge with its measure unit specifier. A range to which the allowance or charge applies may be specified. e.g. An allowance of a free quantity of 20 pieces may be specified if the quantity ordered is greater than 1000 pieces.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range to which the allowance or charge applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments specifying the percentage for the allowance or charge, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is calculated as 5% of the goods value or a price reduction of 5% may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is within the range 5 tons to 10 tons.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage and the percentage basis for the calculation of the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments specifying a monetary amount for an allowance or charge. A range to which the allowance or charge applies can be specified.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the allowance/charge amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments specifying the rate per unit and basis to which the allowance or charge applies, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is 3 DEM per 10 tons.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range for the application of the allowance/charge rate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge and, when necessary, the location(s) to which that tax information relates.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category, and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the allowance or charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information for the group of items referred to in BII.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the valuation. Identification of the contractor and client parties is mandatory for the valuation message. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified. e.g. The contractor and client are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required, but the subcontractors addresses may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the NAD segment e.g. internal site/building number.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution (e.g. bank) and relevant account numbers for the contractor, client and where necessary other parties.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, To provide amounts to be paid to each beneficiary, especially sub-contractors.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments for giving references only relevant to the specified party rather than the whole valuation.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments identifying the documentary requirements of the specified party.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying and providing information relating to the documents required by the party specified by the NAD.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time of the document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation:
COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A service segment placed at the beginning of the detail section to avoid collision.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments providing the quantities and the corresponding prices of the works performed for each item, or group of items.

segment.name: Structure identification
segment.documentation: BII, A segment to identify the item of work (or group of items) to which the quantities apply.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to provide requirements that are applicable to the whole group of segments: financial status (when an item is added to the BOQ, dayworks for example), and an action request.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment giving the quantity of works performed, in cumulative, last period cumulative, quantity of the period, and other forms as required.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment used to indicate the unit price of the items.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment used to indicate monetary amount which are the computation of the unit price and quantities quoted in QTY.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments to record descriptive text for items that are added into existing groups during the completion of the works, e.g. dayworks.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment to record a qualifier specifying that we are at item level.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments to record the description line details together with text reference numbers and change action codes used to identify who is authorised to apply changes.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, This segment is used to convey any descriptive material to be recorded for the item. This descriptive material can apply to the item description and item heading information.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment used to record up to two text reference numbers per item description line.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment used to record up to two text change action codes per item description line. In this context suppression is not allowed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments to convey the results of the computation of the fluctuation formulas and the relevant dates/periods for this item when it is different from the group to which this item belongs.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment to indicate the date or period of application of the factor quoted in APR.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate the date or period of application of the factor quoted in APR.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: A group of segments specifying tax related information for this item when it is specific to this item or different from the group to which it belongs, and when necessary, the location(s) to which that tax information relates.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying a tax type, category and rate, or exemption, relating to the group of items referred to in BII. e.g. Value Added Tax at the standard rate is applicable for all items.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the identified tax/fee.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location to which the tax or exemption specified in the TAX segment applies, e.g. city or state or country tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the item referred to in BII where this is different to or not specified within the group of items to which it belongs.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary its calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A group of segments specifying the quantity of the allowance or charge with its measure unit specifier. A range to which the allowance or charge applies may be specified. e.g. An allowance of a free quantity of 20 pieces may be specified if the quantity ordered is greater than 1000 pieces.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range to which the allowance or charge applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: A group of segments specifying the percentage for the allowance or charge, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is calculated as 5% of the goods value or a price reduction of 5% may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is within the range 5 tons to 10 tons.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage and the percentage basis for the calculation of the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: A group of segments specifying a monetary amount for an allowance or charge. A range to which the allowance or charge applies can be specified.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the allowance/charge amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 32: A group of segments specifying the rate per unit and basis to which the allowance or charge applies, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is 3 DEM per 10 tons.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range for the application of the allowance/charge rate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 33: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge and, when necessary, the location(s) to which that tax information relates.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category, and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation:
MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the allowance or charge.
4.1.3 Summary section
Information to be provided in the Summary section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A service segment placed at the beginning of the summary section to avoid collision.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 34: A group of segments specifying taxes totals for the valuation.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type to be summarized.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the tax specified.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment by which control totals may be provided by the sender for checking by the receiver.
